Posts.Content: Lynette73 wrote: In Nov 2014, I had a stereotactic biopsy on the L breast, nothing in my reports notated for the right. In Aug they found a solid mass & complex cyst with debris @ 9oclock in the R, also with 2 groups of round punctate calcifications. I had a CNB and it came back as a sclerosing intraductal papilloma. I'm waiting to meet with a surgeon. I am now having pain in the R armpit area and it feels swollen, also right below my collarbone is swollen and painful to the touch. I thought it may have been irritation from the biopsy since it started 3 days after, but it has now been such for 3 weeks. I have a few questions: 1.Is this normal to have this pain etc? (this is the 3rd CNB on this breast and I have never had complications 2.If there is a complex cyst with debris, do they generally biopsy the cyst and fluid to see what the debris is? There was no microscopic info on the path report only the gross description and dx. Is it common to have both a mass and cyst in the same area? Can this mask possible malignancy? Posts.Content: Apr 18, 2012 11:36PM Lynette73 wrote: Glad to hear of your b9 results. I didn't get to speak with the surgeon after, so im going to call tomorrow. I too have lots of questions,, he wants to see me in 7 -10 days. My results should be back in 3 to 5 dys. He told hubby everything looked benign, but I will feel more relieved once the path report comes back... My meds are kicking in.... Just wanted to lend my support to u....keep us updated Crystal

Posts.Content: Lynette73 wrote: It is now 1:48am an i just got home from the ER. I had a bilateral excisional biopsies done on 4/18 to have masses (3 in the RT and recurring cyst LT) removed. Path reports came back as several papillomas in everything removed and ADH. Tonight, I was laying down and felt pain in my left arm pit. After inspecting, I noticed a small lump. soon pain began radiating in my shoulder and LT breast. Within 30 min, my entire breast felt like it was 20 lbs and became rock hard. It literally felt like it was a balloon that was about to pop. My nipple is hard and there was a lump that felt like a hard mass. They did and ultasound and stated that the spot where the mass was removed has filled with fluid. The measurement is 5.9 x 5.7 x 3.0 cm. Since i have no signs of infection, drainage, or fever, they released me and told me to f/u with my surgeon tomorrow. My post op appt is scheduled for monday. My entire breast is hurting and swollen. I also noticed a red rash on the breast. Has this happenend to any of you? I'm worried that I may have to have another surgery as I dont think that something this large can be aspirated. Any help or advise is greatly appreciated!!! Crystal Log in to post a reply
